content: I don't have access to the latest data on the investments made in punjab's startups. however, punjab's startup ecosystem has been a source of attraction for investors from the private sector, government, and global investors. some of the startups have received investments from prominent investors such as infosys co-founder narayana murthy's catamaran ventures, ratan tata, and sequoia capital, among others. these investments have helped the startups scale their operations, expand their market reach, and bring new innovations to their respective industries. punjab has also benefited from collaborations and partnerships of big companies with startups in the region, bringing new synergies and opportunities for entrepreneurship as they continue to grow. the state has been acting as a gateway to the north indian market, attracting investment interest from overseas companies too. the state's ecosystem that promotes innovation and entrepreneurial spirit has earned it well-deserved attention from investors, paving the way for a thriving startup ecosystem in punjab.
